column1: Claim
COVID-19 appears to be more contagious and to spread more quickly than the flu.
Individuals with hypertension get more serious cases of COVID-19.
Vitamin D may improve odds of survival from COVID-19.
Blood pressure drugs linked to lower COVID-19 mortality.
Heart disease is the main cause of death for COVID-19 patients.
Social distancing is the most effective measure of containing the spread of the new coronavirus.
Coronavirus deaths are higher for people living with diabetes than those without the condition.
Wet weather can kill the new coronavirus.
Self-isolation fundamentally changed our lifestyles.
Vitamin deficiency may raise risk of serious COVID-19.
The use of ACE inhibitors was associated with an almost 40% lower risk of COVID-19 hospitalization.
Heart damage lingers in COVID-19 patients, even after recovery.
The coronavirus can live on a surgical mask for 7 days.
Most people infected with COVID-19 will recover without requiring special treatment.
Supplementation like Vitamin D is not a bad idea to fight COVID-19.
Early symptoms for COVID-19 include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
SARS-CoV-2 is spread by respiratory droplets produced when people breathe, talk, sneeze, or cough.
Blood pressure drugs appear to make COVID-19 worse.
ACE inhibitors and ARBs are not the likely culprits for increased severity in cardiovascular disease patients with COVID-19.
Vitamin D appears to increase COVID-19 mortality rates.
Drugs for high blood pressure appear to make COVID-19 worse.
ACEIs and ARBs increase numbers of ACE2 receptors, potentially raising COVID-19 risks.
Not all masks confer equal levels of protection.
Yes, the novel coronavirus can survive on surfaces.
Coronavirus deaths are primarily caused by COVID-19 itself, not comorbidities.
Many experts believe COVID-19's rapid decline in certain patients is tied to their immune system.
Patients treated with ACEIs and ARBs may be at increased risk for severe outcomes.
Coronavirus deaths are primarily caused by COVID-19 itself, not comorbidities.
